title: Meanwhile, at Riot HQ
body:
They discuss how to become a more player centric company.

Edit: KateyKhaos hijacked my thread. ggwp

replies.body:
While I can't speak on how other teams grab player feedback, I can speak on behalf of skins! 

As you've probably seen, we post PBE threads about new content. After a couple days of the content being out on PBE, we collect player feedback from several forums (these boards, S@20, Reddit, Skin Spotlights on YouTube, etc). We compile the feedback in the form of screenshots, quotes, etc, and email them to the team who is working on the skin. 

With that being said, there's plenty of feedback that we see and use, but don't comment on. It'd be pretty hard to reply to every comment made about a skin, be it positive or negative feedback. 

At the end of the day, we can't make everyone happy when it comes to new content, and from my personal experience, especially with skins. To be honest, it sucks. Making one skin to please everyone is pretty impossible, but we do our best to voice the opinion of players and to try and make as many happy as possible, based on the commentary we see on the boards.

Thanks for taking the time to reply to my thread. I don't think anyone has a problem with the skins team. It's mainly some of the other teams. Particularly, more recently, the lore team. 

By the way, while you're here, I have a question for you. Will Flying Spaghetti Monster Vel'koz ever be a thing? Because I really want it to be a thing.
Some areas of the rework squadron have also been failing to recognize community input as well :/ *stashu deathglare*

No, stashu has replied a ton to all of you. More than a lot of rioters. I'm honestly surprised he still is doing it. Yeah, we get it, you don't like the cass rework. But many people complaining about it have shown incredibly poor attitudes and behaviors in their posts, going as far as to say he should be FIRED for one thing he has done. Seriously, enough is enough. There does not need to be anymore attacking stashu. Every time he responds people just yell at him. I don't care if you don't like his ideas because they don't agree with yours, the behavior regarding what he has done is excessive.

Replying to us, and *listening to feedback*, are completely different things. Anything that goes against his passive or twin fang centric kit is snubbed, despite the fact that 9/10 people want nothing more than to see those ideas go, he won't even acknowledge that it might be time to shift away from them.

And yes, I agree some people have gone overboard. The death threats and requests to have him fired are too much, but to say nothing is to accept his actions, and that's not okay either. 

I don't think it's inappropriate to ask someone to step aside when their goals and the desires of the playerbase don't line up, with no intention of compromise.

He has been taking feed back into account, people just don't like the way he is implementing it. People say they want poison to matter, so he makes e buff poison damage (which honestly seems to be rather unclear for those who are poisoned how much damage they should be taking). Do I like all of the changes, not really. Then again, I was never a big cass player. She was a fun lane bully when she was one but other than that I wasn't that invested. 

The simple fact of the matter is he is trying. He has to get changes approved by people too. Even if he likes or agrees with community feedback, he can't just throw it into the game. It has to be approved by others as well. People should remember that as he works on it. 

And to say 9/10 people want it changed is a bit much. 9/10 people posting on the forums about it hate the changes. Most league players are either indifferent, don't hate it that much and just want it to not be weak, or don't even know it was changed (honestly tons of people don't read patch notes, never really knowing when certain champs change).

Is a Christmas skin too much to ask for for a champion that's severely lacking in quality and variety?

If no one has an idea for a skin for her there isn't much they can do. Sure, there are community ideas, but if no one has an idea of how to take them then it doesn't matter. I too want a lux skin, but if there are no ideas then that is how it is. Also there is supposedly an ultimate skin coming out eventually so who knows, maybe it is hers.

Mistletoe Lux. She's essentially wearing what Misteltoe Leblanc is. Her staff/wand(?) is a candy cane. Her Q shoots out a Wreath that when an enemy gets bound will be shown around them. Her W throws out two ornaments. Her E throws out a present or fruitcake that explodes. Her R shoots a red and white(or green?) beam.
If Lux ever gets a Christmas skin, I'd think she would look better in a straight candy cane/peppermint theme.

*"The PBE appears to be treated as too far down the pipe to actually change anything before it goes out."*

That's simply not true. We push content to PBE a couple weeks before it's scheduled to be completed and put in the next patch. With that being said, it's super important that we get player feedback ASAP. If you give us feedback a couple days before we're scheduled to be done (and it's not something that's gamebreaking and absolutely needs to be fixed), chances are, it won't be added / changed. 

Keep in mind that when we make changes to content, it needs to be re-tested. For example, if we change, say, one of  Snow Day Malzahar's skills, we need to test that skill again on all of his skins, not just Snow Day Malzahar, to make sure nothing got messed up.

I wouldn't say I'm lying. 

Prime example - I collected feedback for Blood Moon Elise when a good portion of players were unhappy with the pink when she initially hit PBE, so we made another revision where she's more red. 

Ultimately, players actively voiced their opinions that they didn't like the red and wanted something that was toned back to a more pink tone. Again, I collected that feedback, and the team is discussing what we should do about it now. 

We may not actively comment on every post or say thing like "We're changing this because players said x, y, and x", but we're reading the comments and acting feedback where applicable.

The skins team is definitely one of the more "on it" teams in regards to factoring in player feedback. I don't know why people are giving you guys crap :/ 

Blood Moon Elise looked very nice in her crimson glory, by the way.
It seems like the skins team is maybe the only team that communicates with players and doesn't lie to their faces? But who knows!

As much as people are saying the pink Elise is lovely, I'm with the people rooting for Red Blood Moon Elise, and here's why...

Right now, more than anything, we need consistancy out of Riot. You can't just come out with pointless Blood Moon skins that have nothing to do with the original premise, and then go changing the color scheme at the same time... You can make another pink skin for Elise. I don't think Blood Moon is the right medium for it.

If feedback is given after the content has been on the PBE for nearly the whole cycle, there's not much we can do, especially if it's something one or two people really doesn't like. (That's why it's super important to voice both positive and negative opinions about content that's coming out!)  

Again, making sure the changes work correctly is a big deal, and takes a bit of time, depending. For example, if we change particles, we have to check the particles on all of the champion's skins to make sure the new skin didn't break anything on the old skins. (Particle theft, it's a real thing, kids!) 

TL;DR: The faster we have feedback, the faster we can act on it. In the end, everyone wins.

This may be rude to say, but I don't feel like the example of malz changes is a good example. The skins shouldn't be released in a poor state because you were worried what changes it would make to other skins. If you are going to sell these skins to the community, at least do us the favor of making them worth buying. We will wait while you make sure they function properly. Instead of screwing us over, plan a starting time on the skins for an earlier date. 

An example of rushed BS skins, Battlecast Skarner vs Battlecast Chogath, I know I have spoke up about him a lot but he was so damn underwhelming that I honestly don't think I'll ever get my hopes up for a skin again. Battlecast Chogath came out a while ago and is pretty on par for a legendary, all his skills have flashy effects, his model and textures are nice and shiney/glowy, etc. Skarner is kind of glowy, but his Q is less visible than a 975 or cheaper skin for him, his W is basically a bubble while the rest of his skins get a crystal armor shell, the rest of the E's are bigger and flashier, and the passive stacks on battlecast are hardly noticeable. The only fancy thing about Battlecast Skarner is his ultimate. Battlecast Skarner should have been a 1350 and we all know it. A small minority is buying that skin. 

Anyway, People mentioned ALL of the above points on the PBE and NONE of them were even touched. It was seriously the most frustrating experience I have had giving feedback about anything League related because as mentioned above, it felt like it was too late to make any changes. That thread was only pinned for 2-3 weeks at most and then he was pushed through. That is a terrible amount of time to receive feedback, make changes, and then receive feedback again. There was no reason the battlecast skins needed to be rushed because there was no event, it was just sheer laziness in my opinion. 

The boards community is the group that is giving feedback on skins, bugs, gameplay, champions, etc. Yet a lot of us feel ignored. I remember when I first got on GD it felt like our opinion was worth something, yet more and more all I see on Boards is people frustrated that we are getting ignored. As much as I love League and think that the skins can look good, I don't feel like it is worth investing any more of my cash into if we just get ignored when we give you feed back like you guys request. If you guys are going to ignore our feedback, just shut the boards down. At least we wont feel like we speaking to a void when we voice our feedback.

As for the Desperada Cass texture update, that's not something the Skins team had a hand in. All texture updates are done by another team called Champion Update.  The Skins team is only focused on making new skins, not updating existing skins. As a matter of fact, the Skins team isn't even responsible for the base skin - that's left up to the Champion team to decide the initial look of the champion.

Okay now it gets all convoluted. So texture is a whole completely different expertise than skin making? Can't help but feel that there being two separate teams may lead to hilarious miscommunication where Jinx's smooth beautiful skin becomes a wrinkled old lady's.


But can we all just shake hands and just agree on one crucial objective fact? Zac needs a new skin, something that changes him beyond *"purple Zac with some whippy things"* (roach swarm Zac? stitched zombie Zac?)

On another note, do you think Wukong's new skin posed a little problem for making skins for certain champions?

At the price the skin team or whoever priced him at, he was...really underwhelming. I guess it didn't help that he's not all that popular a champion to begin with, but his kit really doesn't lend itself all too well to legendary skins.


I mean, compared to your average AP champion with all their snazzy spells and animations, what does a kit like Wukong's have to work with that makes it worth that price? A lot of his kit is just the ways a monkey man can swing his stick.

We wouldn't otherwise have enough time to update older skins, since we're usually pretty packed with new content. Champion Update is also responsible for reworks, so they've got a lot on their plate, too. 

I absolutely agree with you that Zac needs a new skin. While I can't say if there's a skin in the works or not, I can tell you that he's a champion we're aware of that needs a new skin. Jinx is also high on that list. 

In regards to Wukong, I think you mean Underworld Wukong.  That skin wasn't legendary, it was 1350 RP. I'm sorry you felt he was underwhelming. About a year and a half ago, we discussed price tiers for content coming out from that point on. It detailed what kind of work went into each price tier. You can check it out [here](http://forums.na.leagueoflegends.com/board/showthread.php?t=3328361). 

One of the reasons he was priced more than a 975 (as listed in that link up there) was because all of his VO had voice processing. That's generally something that separates a 975 RP skin from a 1350 RP skin. He also had a new model and texture, a new recall animation, and new particles. 

Again, I can't say what we've got planned, but I do agree with you that making a legendary skin for someone who is melee, let's say Garen, is definitely harder than making a legendary for someone who is particle heavy, like Veigar. I think it can be done, but it would definitely take a lot of thought and planning. Xin Zhao is definitely on the more difficult end of the spectrum, like you're implying.

Sona rework was just an example. When Fearless was reworking her, instead accepting players opinions, all he did was to explain and try to make players accept his ideas. He never changed anything, he simply wanted players to accept.

Sona's problem never was a playstyle thing. It was a numbers thing, you simply nerfed her too much and that's why she wasn't played, you simply don't want a support dealing damage, which I don't see which is the problem, we already have enough viable options on support and Sona before nerfing granted one thing: Diversity. Now, on the things she can do, there's always one champ who excels on something she does. And since her rework was already dealing damage as before, you simply made the same thing on last patch. And she will return to the same position as before.

Again nothing to you personally, and also must say that I'm using Sona only as example, I like her (even though I don't play her much), but there're many other examples people can give. Skarner or Cassio rework, the turret changes on patch 4.1, the increase of knockups, no items to help immovale adcs like Ashe, etc etc. You guys when making most decision don't thing about what players say but what you simply think, and just decide if your opinions are the same.
